üí° $BNB - Trade Idea


BNB is forming a massive double top pattern in the 4H timeframe.


This pattern is pretty clear and tells us that the short uptrend is dying.


The downside target is quite far at $850, which is the 1.618 fibonacci target.


A short entry here from the the current price is a good setup.

$BNB   is consolidating around 907 after rejection from 920 resistance. Price remains above MA7 (904.55) and MA25 (902.71), showing bullish structure. However, declining volume suggests weakening momentum. The chart displays a potential double-top pattern near 920, which could lead to a pullback before another attempt higher. Trade Setup: TP1: 895 TP2: 885 TP3: 875 Stop Loss: 925

üö® NOW: BNB Chain leads in 24h fees, overtaking Solana.

$BNB maintained its lead among CEX exchanges in key metrics, including spot and derivatives volumes, reserves, and on-chain activity.

The exchange facilitated around $7 trillion in spot trades, processed $25.4 trillion in perpetual $BTC futures volume, and accumulated the largest reserves of stablecoins and major crypto assets.

The CryptoQuant report also records a high level of on-chain operations, including altcoins, reflecting the concentration of liquidity and user activity on a single platform.

2025 in Review: Partnerships and Integrations

36 dApp integrations. 19 blockchain deployments. DIA Oracle Grants launched in cooperation with 20+ leading chains.

DIA expanded across DeFi, RWAs, AI, gaming, and infrastructure layers.

Here's how the network grew üßµ 
DeFi protocols secured live markets with DIA oracles. Morpho, Euler, and Silo integrated on Ethereum and Base.

Hydration integrated custom DEX scrapers on Polkadot.

Parallel Protocol deployed across HyperEVM, Sonic, Base, and Avalanche. 
DIA deployed on 19 new blockchains in 2025.

Key integrations included Arbitrum, Unichain, and HyperEVM, and expansion across Base, Alephium, Plume, Kadena, Somnia and others.

DIA's verifiable oracle infrastructure is now available across 60+ major L2s and specialized chains. https://twitter.com/1026772462296547328/status/1996611947199136071
RWA infrastructure scaled with xReal deployments across Avalanche, Plume, Base, XRPL, and Polygon.

DIA powered RWA-backed protocols like KlimaDAO and Azos Finance with verifiable collateral pricing for equities, bonds, commodities, and FX rates. https://twitter.com/1026772462296547328/status/1947292013902393626
Adoption expanded beyond DeFi. AI applications integrated verifiable data across MAFIA AI, Nuklai, and GraphAI.

Gaming platforms like MoonshotBoxes adopted DIA oracles.

MCPM launched as the first DIA-secured memecoin prediction market. https://twitter.com/1026772462296547328/status/1958188377037267391
Infrastructure partnerships embedded DIA as default oracle infrastructure.

AltLayer integrated DIA oracles into their Rollups-as-a-Service platform.
Saga added support for Chainlet deployments.

DIA became an official service provider for BNB Chain Kickstart Program. https://twitter.com/1026772462296547328/status/2002027893694816491
The Oracle Grants Program launched with 20 partner chains subsidizing oracle costs for builders.

Teams receive up to one year of free oracle access.

Partners include Arbitrum, Avalanche, Polygon, Sonic, BNB Chain, Linea, and Plume. 
2025 demonstrated clear demand for transparent, verifiable oracle infrastructure.

36 integrations. 19 blockchains. 20 grant partners.

Focus for 2026: DeFi vaults and institutional adoption.

Full recap: https://www.diadata.org/blog/post/2025-partnerships-integrations/
